newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian 364-day t-bill yield seen steady.
newsitem.headline: Indian 364-day t-bill yield seen steady.

text.p: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) is expected to maintain the yield at 9.0 percent at the fortnightly auction of 364-day treasury bills on Wednesday, dealers said.
"The RBI is deliberately keeping a low cut-off," the head of money markets at a Bombay bank said.
Many dealers said the response at the treasury bill auction is impacted by the prevailing overnight call money rates.
Call rates were quoted at 7.75-8.75 percent in latest trade, up from 7.5-8.5 percent opening, dealers said.
Because of the firm call rates, response at Wednesday's auction will be lukewarm, dealers said.

"The bank rate cut has no impact on treasury bill yields," said R. Narayan, assistant manager (treasury) at Bank of Nova Scotia. "Notwithstanding a cut in bank rate and deposit rate, there is no incentive to bid below nine percent."
